intro: Polycnemum pentandrum, commonly known as the five-stamen fern, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and other related plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
